meanings.definition: A machine for registering and indicating the total amount of bets placed on a race or other event.
meanings.sent1: The totalisators at the racetrack displayed the amount of money bet on each horse.
meanings.sent2: Fans eagerly watched the totalisators to see which horse was receiving the most bets.
meanings.sent3: The totalisators seemed to have a mind of their own, constantly updating with new information.
meanings.sent4: The totalisators hummed softly, like a chorus of tiny calculators keeping track of the bets.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the totalisators made them stand out in the dimly lit room.

meanings.definition: A system of betting in which all bets are pooled and winners share the total amount wagered.
meanings.sent1: Totalisators ensure that all bets are combined, creating a larger prize for the winners.
meanings.sent2: Participants in the totalisators eagerly awaited the final tally to see how much they had won.
meanings.sent3: In the world of totalisators, even the smallest bet could lead to a big win.
meanings.sent4: The concept of totalisators is like a potluck dinner where everyone contributes and shares the feast.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of totalisators makes them a popular choice for betting on various events.
